Definitions: The month for which the production occurred.
The calendar year for the month in which the production occurred.
This field distinguishes federal lands and waters from Native American lands.
This field distinguishes between onshore and offshore prouction.
We have monthly data for oil, gas, and coal, since these are high-volume commodities that result in the most revenue. This field includes the units for each commodity in parantheses.
Oil production is measured in barrels (bbl)
Gas (natural gas) is measured in thousand cubic feet (mcf)
Coal is measured in tons. A ton is 2000 pounds.
Shows the production volume (amount produced). The units for volume are shown in the preceding field (Commodity).
